intro: Vignea striata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves with a distinct white or pale green stripe running along the midrib. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. Vignea striata is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many other vine species. It thrives in warm climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
